{{ja-kanjitab|しょう|ねん|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
{{IPAchar|/seunen/}} → {{IPAchar|/ɕeunen/}} → {{IPAchar|/ɕoːnen/}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しょうねん}} compound {{m|zh|少年|tr=syew<sup>H</sup> nen|lit=young + years}}. Compare modern {{etyl|yue|-}} reading ''siu<sup>3</sup> nin<sup>4</sup>'', {{etyl|cmn|-}} ''shàonián'', {{cog|ko|소년}}, {{cog|vi|thiếu niên}}.

Originally referred to young people of either gender. The meaning has narrowed in modern usage to more commonly refer to [[boy]]s of [[elementary school]] or [[middle school]] age.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>
